Historical -- Sam Houston taught here in 1812 before moving on to military and political careers

row.title: Pflanze Building

Commercial -- originally a furniture and casket shop, the building later housed a Five and Dime, a movie theater, and a drug store.

row.public_note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Unoccupied
Address: Corner Wright Rd. and Harding St., Alcoa, TN
row.abstract: Architectural and cultural history -- one story house of pink marble with basement and arched and hip roof. Built by William Andrew Nicholson, by hand, from 1937 to 1946, "to survive Armageddon and enjoy the millennium to follow."
